ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Prerequisites/Preconditions] This protocol operates against a site that is identified by a URL that is known by protocol clients.
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The protocol server endpoint is formed by appending "/_vti_bin/Dws.asmx" to the site URLâ€”for example "www.contoso.com/Repository/_vti_bin/Dws.asmx".
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] This protocol assumes that authentication has been performed by the underlying protocols.

[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The account that accesses this Web service is assigned an appropriate role in the Document Workspace Members group or for the site that contains, or will contain, the Document Workspace site.
[In Messages] In the following sections[Section 2], the schema definition might differ from the processing rules imposed by the protocol.
[In Messages] The WSDL in this specification matches the WSDL that shipped with the product and provides a base description of the schema.
[In Messages] The text that introduces the WSDL might specify differences that reflect actual Microsoft product behavior.

[In Messages] For example, the schema definition might allow for an element to be empty, null, or not present but the behavior of the protocol as specified restricts the same elements to being non-empty, not null and present.
[In Transport] Protocol servers MUST support SOAP over HTTP.
[In Transport] Protocol servers SHOULD additionally support SOAP over HTTPS for securing communication with protocol clients.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-DWSS_R686.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Transport] Protocol messages MUST be formatted as specified in [SOAP1.1] SOAP Envelope section 4, or in [SOAP1.2-1/2007] SOAP Message Construct section 5.

[In Transport] Protocol server faults MUST be returned by using HTTP status codes as specified in [RFC2616] Status Code Definitions section 10 or SOAP faults as specified in [SOAP1.1] SOAP Fault section 4.4 or in [SOAP1.2-1/2007] SOAP Fault section 5.4.
[In Common Message Syntax] The syntax[Common Message Syntax] of the definitions uses XML schema, as specified in [XMLSCHEMA1/2] and [XMLSCHEMA2/2], and WSDL, as specified in [WSDL].
[In Namespaces] This specification defines and references various XML namespaces by using the mechanisms specified in [XMLNS].

[In Namespaces] Although this specification associates a specific namespace prefix for each namespace that is used, the choice of any particular namespace prefix is implementation-specific and not significant for interoperability.
[In Namespaces] Prefix "soap" is used for namespace URI "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/", more information refers to "[WSDL]".
[In Namespaces] Prefix "tns" is used for namespace URI "http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/dws/".
[In Namespaces] Prefix "s" is used for namespace URI "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema ", more information refers to "[XMLSCHEMA1]".
[In Namespaces] Prefix "xs" is used for namespace URI "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema ", more information refers to "[XMLSCHEMA1]".
[In Namespaces] Prefix "soap12" is used for namespace URI "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap12/ ", more information refers to "[WSDL]".
[In Namespaces] Prefix "wsdl" is used for namespace URI "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/ ", more information refers to "[WSDL]".
[In Messages] This specification does not define any common WSDL message definitions.
[In Elements] The following table summarizes the set of common XML schema element definitions by this specification: [Assignees, Error, ID, List, Member and Roles].
[In Elements] XML schema element definitions that are specific to a particular operation are described with the operation.
[In Elements] Assignees means: Returns a list of assigned members for a Document Workspace.
[In Elements] Error means: Returns an error code from DWS operations.
[In Elements] ID means: Contains a GUID with an optional attribute.
[In Elements] List means: Returns data about a list(1).
[In Elements] Returns data about a user or group.
[In Elements] Roles means: Contains role information about a list or document.
[In Assignees] This element [Assignees] holds the list of assigned users for a Document Workspace.
[In Assignees] It is used only in the stand-alone XML returned from the GetDwsData and the GetDwsMetaData operations.
[In Assignees] This element [Assignees] is used within the standalone XML returned from the GetDwsData operation.
[In Assignees] This element [Assignees] is only used within the standalone XML returned from the GetDwsMetaData operation.

[In Assignees] This element[Assignees] is defined as follows: <xs:element name="Assignees"> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence> <xs:element ref="tns:Member" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:element>
[In Error] This element [Error] returns an error indication.
[In Error] It [Error] contains a restricted string indication, as well as an integer code that corresponds to the string.
[In Error] Optionally, it [Error] contains a URL that the user on the protocol client accesses to authenticate and gain the necessary permissions.

[In Error] This element[Error] is defined as follows: <xs:simpleType name="ErrorTypes"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ServerFailure"/> <xs:enumeration value="Failed"/> <xs:enumeration value="NoAccess"/> <xs:enumeration value="Conflict"/> <xs:enumeration value="ItemNotFound"/> <xs:enumeration value="MemberNotFound"/> <xs:enumeration value="ListNotFound"/> <xs:enumeration value="TooManyItems"/> <xs:enumeration value="DocumentNotFound"/> <xs:enumeration value="FolderNotFound"/> <xs:enumeration value="WebContainsSubwebs"/> <xs:enumeration value="ADMode"/> <xs:enumeration value="AlreadyExists"/> <xs:enumeration value="QuotaExceeded"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:element name="Error"> <xs:complexType> <xs:simpleContent> <xs:extension base="tns:ErrorTypes"> <xs:attribute name="ID"> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:integer"> <xs:minInclusive value="1"/> <xs:maxInclusive value="14"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:attribute> <xs:attribute name="AccessUrl" type="xs:string"/> </xs:extension> </xs:simpleContent> </xs:complexType> </xs:element>
[In Error] AccessUrl: This is a URL that the protocol client SHOULD use to gain the necessary access permissions.
[In Error] This attribute [AccessUrl] can be present when the Error field is set to "NoAccess".
[In Error] This attribute [AccessUrl] MUST NOT be present in any other case,[when the Error field is not set to "NoAccess"].
[In Error] This attribute [AccessUrl] MUST NOT be present when the Error element contains ServerFailure error code.
[In Error] This attribute [AccessUrl] MUST NOT be present when the Error element contains Failed error code.
[In Error] This attribute [AccessUrl] MUST NOT be present when the Error element contains Conflict error code.
[In Error] This attribute [AccessUrl] MUST NOT be present when the Error element contains ItemNotFound error code.
[In Error] This attribute [AccessUrl] MUST NOT be present when the Error element contains ListNotFound error code.
[In Error] This attribute [AccessUrl] MUST NOT be present when the Error element contains TooManyItems error code.
[In Error] This attribute [AccessUrl] MUST NOT be present when the Error element contains DocumentNotFound error code.
[In Error] This attribute [AccessUrl] MUST NOT be present when the Error element contains FolderNotFound error code.
[In Error] This attribute [AccessUrl] MUST NOT be present when the Error element contains WebContainsSubwebs error code.
[In Error] This attribute [AccessUrl] MUST NOT be present when the Error element contains AlreadyExists error code.
[In Error] Error: This is a string with the error type.
[In Error] ID: Error type index, converted to a string.

[In Error] The value [ID] MUST match the error type as listed in the following table: [ServerFailure 1, Failed 2, NoAccess 3, Conflict 4, ItemNotFound 5, MemberNotFound 6, ListNotFound 7, TooManyItems 8, DocumentNotFound 9, FolderNotFound 10, WebContainsSubwebs 11, ADMode 12, AlreadyExists 13, QuotaExceeded 14].

[In Error] ID: Error codes that can be returned are also in the table:[ServerFailure 1, Failed 2, NoAccess 3, Conflict 4, ItemNotFound 5, MemberNotFound 6, ListNotFound 7, TooManyItems 8, DocumentNotFound 9, FolderNotFound 10, WebContainsSubwebs 11, ADMode 12, AlreadyExists 13, QuotaExceeded 14].

[In Error] ID: See the individual operation specifications for the situations in which these codes [ServerFailure 1, Failed 2, NoAccess 3, Conflict 4, ItemNotFound 5, MemberNotFound 6, ListNotFound 7, TooManyItems 8, DocumentNotFound 9, FolderNotFound 10, WebContainsSubwebs 11, ADMode 12, AlreadyExists 13, QuotaExceeded 14] are returned.
[In Error] The error types ADMode and MemberNotFound are reserved and not sent.
[In Error] The value 1 [ID] matches the Error type ServerFailure.
[In Error] The value 2 [ID] matches the Error type Failed.
[In Error] The value 3 [ID] matches the Error type NoAccess.
[In Error] The value 4 [ID] matches the Error type Conflict.
[In Error] The value 5 [ID] matches the Error type ItemNotFound.
[In Error] The value 6 [ID] matches the Error type MemberNotFound.
[In Error] The value 7 [ID] matches the Error type ListNotFound.
[In Error] The value 8 [ID] matches the Error type TooManyItems.
[In Error] The value 9 [ID] matches the Error type DocumentNotFound.
[In Error] The value 10 [ID] matches the Error type FolderNotFound.
[In Error] The value 11 [ID] matches the Error type WebContainsSubwebs.
[In Error] The value 12 [ID] matches the Error type ADMode.
[In Error] The value 13 [ID] matches the Error type AlreadyExists.
[In Error] The value 14 [ID] matches the Error type QuotaExceeded.
[In ID] The ID element is used in the List structure to return a GUID that identifies a document for which the protocol server returns error information.
[In ID] The DefaultUrl attribute specifies a page on which the user can view the contents of the list.

[In ID] This element is defined as follows: <xs:element name="ID"> <xs:complexType> <xs:simpleContent> <xs:extension base="xs:string"> <xs:attribute name="DefaultUrl" type="xs:string"/> </xs:extension> </xs:simpleContent> </xs:complexType> </xs:element>
[In List] This element [List] returns the information about the contents of a list.

[In List] It[List] is defined as follows: <xs:element name="List"> <xs:complexType> <xs:choice> <xs:element ref="tns:Error"/> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="NoChanges" type="xs:string"/> <xs:sequence> <xs:sequence> <xs:element ref="tns:ID"/> <xs:choice> <xs:element ref="tns:Error" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:sequence> <xs:any minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded" namespace="##other" processContents='skip'/> </xs:sequence> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:sequence> </xs:choice> </xs:choice> <xs:attribute name="Name" type="tns:ListType" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> </xs:element>
[In List] NoChanges: This element MUST be returned when the protocol client has provided a LastUpdate parameter and the specified document has not changed since the value in LastUpdate.
[In List] This element [NoChanges] MUST be empty.
[In List] ID: Contains a GUID that corresponds to a document on the server.
[In List] Name: Describes the list contents.
[In List] The list is identified by the Name attribute in the List element.
[In List] The following table shows restrictions on the rest of the structure based on the Name attribute: [Tasks, Documents, and Links].
[In List] Task: The list of tasks associated with this workspace.
[In List] Tasks: The list contains a sequence of XML elements with information about the tasks.
[In List] Documents: The list of documents associated with this workspace.
[In List] Documents: The list contains a sequence of z:row elements with information about the documents.
[In List] Links: The list of external links associated with this workspace.
[In List] Links: It contains a sequence of XML elements with information about the links contained in the list.
[In List] Error: Specifies that an error occurred while accessing the list data.
[In List] The error codes that can be returned are described in the following table: ListNotFound, NoAccess, ServerFailure, TooManyItems.
[In List] ServerFailure means: Protocol server encountered an unspecified error.
[In List] NoAccess means: Authenticated user does not have sufficient permissions to access list information for the Document Workspace.
[In List] ListNotFound means: The specified list does not exist in the Document Workspace.
[In List] TooManyItems means: The number of lists exceeds an implementation-specific size<1>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-DWSS_R675.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In List] The List element can contain an array of z:row elements in any of its elements.
[In List] In a z:row element, the z is equal to #RowsetSchema in the ActiveX Data Objects (ADO) XML Persistence format (see [MS-PRSTFR]).
[In List] Each z:row element describes a single list item.
[In List] The names of the attributes of this element [z:row] correspond to the names of fields in the list.(For more details, see [MS-WSSFO2].)
[In Member] This element [Member] contains information about a member of the workspace.

[In Member] This element[Member] is defined as follows: <s:element name="Member"> <s:complexType> <s:all> <s:element name="ID" type="s:integer"/> <s:element name="Name" type="s:string"/> <s:element name="LoginName" type="s:string"/> <s:element name="Email" type="s:string" minOccurs="0"/> <s:element name="IsDomainGroup" minOccurs="0"> <s:simpleType> <s:restriction base="s:string"> <s:enumeration value="True" /> <s:enumeration value="False" /> </s:restriction> </s:simpleType> </s:element> </s:all> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In Member] ID: A positive integer that MUST uniquely identify a user.
[In Member] ID: A positive integer that MUST uniquely identify a group.
[In Member] Name: A string that contains a friendly name for the user or group.
[In Member] LoginName: Represents the name used to log on to the protocol server.
[In Member] If IsDomainGroup is set to True, this field [LoginName] MUST be empty.
[In Member] E-mail: A string containing the e-mail address of the user.
[In Member] If IsDomainGroup is set to True, this field [E-mail] MUST be empty.
[In Member] IsDomainGroup: A Boolean value specifying whether this record is associated with a user or group.
[In Member] When its value [IsDomainGroup] is "True", it [This member] is a group.
[In Member] When its value [IsDomainGroup] is "False", it [This member] is a user.
[In Roles] The Roles element contains information about how to grant access permissions to users.

[In Roles] This element[Roles] is defined as follows: <xs:element name="Roles"> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element ref="tns:Error"/> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Role" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xs:complexType> <xs:attribute name="Name" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="Type" type="tns:RoleType" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="Description" type="xs:string" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:element>
[In Roles] Error: Specifies that an error has occurred while accessing the Roles data.
[In Roles] The error codes are described in the following table: NoAccess, ServerFailure.
[In Roles] NoAccess means: Authenticated user does not have sufficient permissions to access role information for the Document Workspace.
[In Roles] ServerFailure means: Protocol server encountered an unspecified error.
[In Roles] Role: Returns the information about a single role.
[In Roles] Name: Returns the friendly name of a role.
[In Roles] Type: Returns the type of role.
[In Roles] Description: Returns a general description of the role.
[In Complex Types] The following table summarizes the set of common XML schema complex type definitions defined by this specification[MS-DWSS].
[In Complex Types] XML schema complex type definitions that are specific to a particular operation are described with the operation.
[In MemberData] This type [MemberData] returns information about a user or group or an error condition that occurred while accessing the user or group data.
[In MemberData] This type [MemberData] returns information about a user or group or an error condition that occurred while accessing the user or group data.
[In MemberData] Which value is chosen depends on the error that occurred.
[In MemberData] Error MUST be used when there is an access issue or an error other than TooManyItems.
[In MemberData] Error MUST be used when there is an access issue.
[In MemberData] Error MUST be used when there is a DocumentNotFound issue.
[In MemberData] Error MUST be used when there is a ListNotFound issue.
[In MemberData] A sequence containing two URL elements and an Error element MUST be used for a TooManyItems error.
[In MemberData] ServerFailure MUST be used for unspecified protocol server errors.

[In MemberData] This type[MemberData] is defined as follows: <xs:complexType name="MemberData"> <xs:choice> <xs:element ref="tns:Error"/> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="DefaultUrl" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="AlternateUrl" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element ref="tns:Error"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:sequence> <xs:element ref="tns:Member" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:choice> </xs:complexType>
[In MemberData] Member: An element describing a single user or group.
[In MemberData] DefaultUrl: A URL to a page with an editable listing of the members of the Document Workspace.
[In MemberData] This URL [DefaultUrl] MUST be returned when the TooManyItems error code is returned.
[In MemberData] AlternateUrl: A URL to a page with an editable listing of the members of the Document Workspace.
[In MemberData] The protocol client can use this URL instead of the DefaultUrl.
[In MemberData] This URL [AlternateUrl] MUST be returned when the TooManyItems error code is returned.
[In MemberData] Error: An Error element containing an error that occurred during access.
[In MemberData] Possible error codes are listed in the following table: [NoAccess, TooManyItems, ServerFailure].
[In MemberData] NoAccess means: The current user does not have access to this information.
[In MemberData] TooManyItems means: The number of members exceeds an implementation-specific size.<2>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-DWSS_R676.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In MemberData] ServerFailure means: The protocol server encountered an unspecified error.

[In Schema] The Schema element is specified in [MS-PRSTFR] section 2.3.1.2. The following XML schema defines the Schema element: <xs:element name='Schema'> <xs:complexType > <xs:choice minOccurs='0' maxOccurs='unbounded'> <xs:element name= 'AttributeType' type='xdr:AttributeType'/> <xs:element name= 'ElementType' type='xdr:ElementType'/> <xs:element ref='xdr:description'/> <xs:any namespace='##other' processContents='skip'/> </xs:choice> <xs:attribute name='name' type='xs:string/> <xs:attribute name='id' type='xs:ID/> <xs:anyAttribute namespace='##other' processContents='skip'/> </xs:complexType> </xs:element>
[In Schema] AttributeType: Specified in [MS-PRSTFR] section 2.3.1.2.
[In Schema] ElementType: Specified in [MS-PRSTFR] section 2.3.1.2.
[In Schema] description: A description for the Schema element.
[In Schema] name: The name of the schema.
[In Schema] id: The identifier of the schema. Specified in [MS-PRSTFR] section 2.3.1.2.
[In Simple Types] The following table summarizes the set of common XML schema simple type definitions defined by this specification:[ListType, RoleType].
[In Simple Types] XML schema simple type definitions that are specific to a particular operation are described with the operation.
[In Simple Types] ListType means: A string that indicates the type of list being returned.
[In Simple Types] RoleType means: A string that indicates the user role.
[In ListType] This simple type lists the values for the Name attribute of the List element as specified in section 2.2.3.4.

[In ListType] This type is defined as follows: <xs:simpleType name="ListType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="Tasks"/> <xs:enumeration value="Documents"/> <xs:enumeration value="Links"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType>
[In RoleType] This string enumeration specifies values for user roles in the GetDwsMetaData structure.

[In RoleType] This type is defined as follows: <xs:simpleType name="RoleType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="None"/> <xs:enumeration value="Reader"/> <xs:enumeration value="Contributor"/> <xs:enumeration value="WebDesigner"/> <xs:enumeration value="Administrator"/> <xs:enumeration value="Editor"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType>
[In RoleType] The following table describes the rights for each role: [None, Reader, Contributor, WebDesigner, and Administrator].
[In RoleType] In the following descriptions, the word "user" is used for the authenticated identity as described in section 1.5.
[In RoleType] None means: This role was created by a user, and is not one of the following four roles.
[In RoleType] Reader means: Has read-only rights to view items, personalize Web Parts, use alerts, and create a top-level Web site by using Self-Service Site Creation.
[In RoleType] Reader means: A reader cannot add content.

[In RoleType] Reader means: When a user is granted the role of reader and creates a site by using Self-Service Site Creation, the user becomes the site owner and a member of the administrator class for the new site.
[In RoleType] Reader means: This does not affect membership for any other site.
[In RoleType] The RoleType contains type: Contributor.

[In RoleType] Contributor means: Has Reader rights, in addition to rights to add items, edit items, delete items, manage list permissions, manage personal views, personalize Web Part pages, and browse directories.
[In RoleType] Contributor means: Contributors cannot create new lists or document libraries, but they can add content to existing lists and document libraries.
[In RoleType] The RoleType contains type:WebDesigner.

[In RoleType] WebDesigner: Has Contributor rights, in addition to the rights to cancel check out, delete items, manage lists, add or customize pages, define and apply themes and borders, and link style sheets.
[In RoleType] WebDesigner: Web Designers can modify the structure of the site and create new lists or document libraries.
[In RoleType] The RoleType contains type: Administrator.
[In RoleType] Administrator: Has all rights from all other roles, in addition to the rights to manage roles and view usage-analysis data.
[In RoleType] Administrator: This role cannot be customized or deleted and contains at least one member (1).
[In RoleType] Administrator: Role members have or can grant themselves access to any item on the site (2).
[In RoleType] Editor<3>: Has Contributor rights, plus the rights to manage lists.
[In RoleType] Editor<3>: Editors can create new lists or document libraries.
[In Attributes] This specification does not define any common XML schema attribute definitions.
[In Groups] This specification does not define any common XML schema group definitions.
[In Attribute Groups] This specification does not define any common XML schema attribute group definitions.
[In Protocol Details] In the following sections [Section 3], the schema definition might differ from the processing rules imposed by the protocol.
[In Protocol Details] The WSDL in this specification matches the WSDL that shipped with the product and provides a base description of the schema.
[In Protocol Details] The text that introduces the WSDL might specifies additional restrictions that reflect actual Microsoft product behavior.

[In Protocol Details] For example, the schema definition might allow for an element to be empty, null, or not present but the behavior of the protocol as specified restricts the same elements to being non-empty, not null, and present.
[In Protocol Details] The client side of this protocol is a pass-throughâ€”that is, no additional timers or other states are required on the client side of this protocol.

[In Protocol Details] Calls made by the higher-layer protocol or application are passed directly to the transport, and the results returned by the transport are passed directly back to the higher-layer protocol or application.
[In Abstract Data Model] This section [Section 3.1.1] describes a conceptual model of possible data organization that an implementation maintains to participate in this protocol.
[In Abstract Data Model] The described organization is provided to facilitate the explanation of how the protocol behaves.
[In Abstract Data Model] This document does not mandate that implementations adhere to this model as long as their external behavior is consistent with that described in this document.
[In Abstract Data Model] A Document Workspace is a site that is set up for collaboration by workgroups.
[In Abstract Data Model] The workspace provides a logical organization of documents, tasks, and links to external resources.

[In Abstract Data Model] The Document Workspace provides tools to assist in the collaboration, including these lists, keeping version history for documents, providing a check out service for documents, and supporting alert subscriptions on documents and lists in the workspace.
[In Abstract Data Model] The workspace can have additional organization added with workspace folders.

[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] The following table summarizes the list of WSDL operations[CanCreateDwsUrl,CreateDws,CreateFolder,DeleteDws,DeleteFolder,FindDwsDoc,GetDwsData,GetDwsMetaData,RemoveDwsUser,RenameDws,UpdateDwsData] as defined by this specification[MS-DWSS].
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] CanCreateDwsUrl: Determines whether a protocol client has the permissions necessary to create a Document Workspace at the specified URL.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] CanCreateDwsUrl: It also returns a URL that is unique for the current site.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] CreateDws: Creates a Document Workspace.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] CreateFolder: Creates a folder in a Document Workspace or another folder.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] DeleteDws: Deletes a Document Workspace.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] DeleteFolder: Deletes a folder in a Document Workspace.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] FindDwsDoc: Obtains the URL of a document stored in a Document Workspace.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] GetDwsData: Returns information about the specified Document Workspace.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] GetDwsMetaData: Returns metadata about the specified Document Workspace.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] RemoveDwsUser: Deletes the specified user from the list of authorized Document Workspace users.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] RenameDws:Renames the title of a Document Workspace.
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] UpdateDwsData: Modifies the metadata associated with a Document Workspace.
[In CanCreateDwsUrl] This operation[CanCreateDwsurl] determines whether an authenticated user has permission to create a Document Workspace at the specified URL.

[In CanCreateDwsUrl] The protocol client sends a CanCreateDwsUrlSoapIn request message, and the protocol server responds with the following CanCreateDwsUrlSoapOut response message: <wsdl:operation name="CanCreateDwsUrl"> <wsdl:input message="tns:CanCreateDwsUrlSoapIn" /> <wsdl:output message="tns:CanCreateDwsUrlSoapOut" /> </wsdl:operation>
[In CanCreateDwsUrl] The protocol server MUST respond with an HTTP 401 error if the user is not authorized to create the specified Document Workspace.

[In CanCreateDwsUrl] The server MUST respond with an Error element, as specified in section 2.2.3.2, with the identifier set to 2 [ and a restricted string of "Failed"] when the length of the site (2) URL is greater than an implementation-dependent length.<3>

[In CanCreateDwsUrl] The server MUST respond with an Error element, as specified in section 2.2.3.2, with [the identifier set to 2 and] a restricted string of "Failed" when the length of the site (2) URL is greater than an implementation-dependent length.<4>
[In Messages] The following WSDL message [CanCreateDwsUrlSoapIn, CanCreateDwsUrlSoapOut] definitions are specific to this operation.
[In Messages] CanCreateDwsUrlSoapIn: Requests the CanCreateDwsUrl WSDL operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.1.
[In Messages] CanCreateDwsUrlSoapOut: Response to the CanCreateDwsUrl operation.
[In CanCreateDwsUrlSoapIn] This message requests the CanCreateDwsUrl WSDL operation.
[In CanCreateDwsUrlSoapIn] The SOAP action value of the message is defined as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/dws/CanCreateDwsUrl.
[In CanCreateDwsUrlSoapIn] The SOAP body contains a CanCreateDwsUrl element.
[In CanCreateDwsUrlSoapOut] This message responds to a CanCreateDwsUrl WSDL operation.
[In CanCreateDwsUrlSoapOut] The SOAP action value of the message is defined as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/dws/CanCreateDwsUrl.
[In CanCreateDwsUrlSoapOut] The SOAP body contains a CanCreateDwsUrlResponse element.
[In Elements] The following XSD element [CanCreateDwsUrl, CanCreateDwsUrlResponse] definitions are specific to this operation.
[In Elements] CanCreateDwsUrl: Contains the parameter for the CanCreateDwsUrl operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.1.
[In Elements] CanCreateDwsUrlResponse: Contains the response to the CanCreateDwsUrl operation request.
[In CanCreateDwsUrl] This element [CanCreateDwsUrl] contains the parameter for the CanCreateDwsUrl WSDL operation.

[In CanCreateDwsUrl] This element is defined as follows: <s:element name="CanCreateDwsUrl"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="url" type="s:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In CanCreateDwsUrl] url: Site-relative URL that specifies where to create the Document Workspace.
[In CanCreateDwsUrl] The URL MUST NOT be empty.
[In CanCreateDwsUrl] The URL MUST be unique for the site.
[In CanCreateDwsUrl] The URL SHOULD be based on the URL provided in the url input parameter.
[In CanCreateDwsUrl] If the url input parameter is empty, the protocol server SHOULD return a created name, such as a GUID.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-DWSS_R695.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In CanCreateDwsUrlResponse] This structure[CanCreateDwsUrlResponse] provides the reply value for the CanCreateDwsUrl operation.

[In CanCreateDwsUrlResponse] This structure is defined as follows: <s:element name="CanCreateDwsUrlResponse"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="CanCreateDwsUrlResult" type="s:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In CanCreateDwsUrlResponse] CanCreateDwsUrlResult: This element contains the return value for the operation.

[In CanCreateDwsUrlResponse] The string[CanCreateDwsUrlResult] MUST be a standalone XML element specified in the following format: <s:complexType> <s:choice> <s:element name="Error" type="Error"/> <s:element name="Result" type="s:string"/> </s:choice> </s:complexType>
[In CanCreateDwsUrlResponse] Error: See section 2.2.3.2 for specification.
[In CanCreateDwsUrlResponse] Result: A site-relative URL that specifies where the Document Workspace is created.
[In CreateDws] This operation[CreateDws] creates a new Document Workspace.

[In CreateDws] The protocol client sends a CreateDwsSoapIn request message, and the protocol server responds with a CreateDwsSoapOut response message, as follows: <wsdl:operation name="CreateDws"> <wsdl:input message="tns:CreateDwsSoapIn" /> <wsdl:output message="tns:CreateDwsSoapOut" /> </wsdl:operation>
[In CreateDws] The protocol client assembles the necessary parameters in a CreateDws element and sends the request in a CreateDwsSoapIn request message.
[In CreateDws] The protocol server MUST create the specified Document Workspace.
[In CreateDws] The protocol server MUST create a CreateDwsResponse response message with a Result element.
[In CreateDws] The protocol server MUST reply with an HTTP 401 error if the authenticated user is not authorized to create the Document Workspace.
[In CreateDws] The protocol server MUST reply with an Error element in the CreateDwsResponse response message if it fails to create the specified Document Workspace.
[In CreateDws] The protocol server MUST return a CreateDwsResponse response message with a Result element.
[In CreateDws] The protocol server MUST return a CreateDwsResponse response message with an Error element.
[In CreateDws] The CreateDwsResponse response message MUST NOT be empty.
[In Messages] The following table summarizes the set of WSDL message definitions[CreateDwsSoapIn,CreateDwsSoapOut] that are specific to this operation[CreateDws].
[In Messages] [The description of] CreateDwsSoapIn [is:] Initiates a CreateDws operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.2, on a protocol server.
[In Messages] [The description of] CreateDwsSoapOut[is:] Response to a CreateDwsSoapIn request.
[In CreateDwsSoapIn] This message [CreateDwsSoapIn] initiates a CreateDws operation on a protocol server.
[In CreateDwsSoapIn] The CreateDws operation creates a Document Workspace.
[In CreateDwsSoapIn] The SOAP action value of the message is defined as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/dws/CreateDws
[In CreateDwsSoapIn] The SOAP body contains a CreateDws element.
[In CreateDwsSoapOut] The CreateDwsSoapOut response message is the response to a CreateDwsSoapIn request message.
[In CreateDwsSoapOut] The SOAP action value of the message is defined as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/dws/CreateDws
[In CreateDwsSoapOut] The SOAP body contains a CreateDwsResponse element.
[In Elements] The following table summarizes the XML schema element definitions[CreateDws,CreateDwsResponse] that are specific to this operation[CreateDws].
[In Elements] [The description of] CreateDws[is] Contains the parameters for the CreateDws operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.2.
[In Elements] [The description of] CreateDwsResponse [is] Contains the response to the CreateDws operation request.
[In CreateDws] This element[CreateDws] contains the parameters for the CreateDws operation.

[In CreateDws] This element[CreateDws] is defined as follows: <s:element name="CreateDws"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="name" type="s:string"/> <s:element name="users" type="s:string"/> <s:element name="title" type="s:string"/> <s:element name="documents" type="s:string"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In CreateDws] name: Specifies the name of the Document Workspace site.
[In CreateDws] This parameter [name] MAY be empty.

[In CreateDws] If this is non-empty and another site with the same name already exists on the site on which the workspace is being created, the protocol server MUST return a ServerFailure error code (see section 2.2.3.2).
[In CreateDws] If [name is] empty, the protocol server MUST use the title parameter as the name of the new workspace.
[In CreateDws] users: String in XML that specifies the users to be added as contributors in the Document Workspace site.
[In CreateDws] This string [users] MAY be empty.

[In CreateDws] When the string[users] is not empty, the XML MUST conform to the following XSD: <s:complexType> <s:element name="items"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="item" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xs:complexType> <s:attribute name="Name" type="s:string" use="required"/> <s:attribute name="Email" type="s:string" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> </s:element> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element> </s:complexType>
[In CreateDws] Name: Friendly name for a user.
[In CreateDws] E-mail: E-mail address of the user.
[In CreateDws] title: The title for the workspace.
[In CreateDws] This string [title] MAY be empty.
[In CreateDws] If the name parameter is empty, the protocol server MUST use the title parameter as the name of the new workspace when there is no site associated with that name.
[In CreateDws] If the name parameter is empty, the protocol server MUST generate a unique name from the title as the name of the new workspace [if there already is a site associate with that name.]
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-DWSS_R1466.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In CreateDws] If the name parameter is empty, the protocol server MUST generate a different name from the title as the name of the new workspace [if there already is a site associate with that name.]
[In CreateDws] If the name and title parameters are empty, the protocol server MUST generate a new unique GUID to use as the name of the new workspace.
[In CreateDws] Documents: String in XML format that contains information to be stored as a key-value pair in the site metadata.
[In CreateDws] This string [Documents] MAY be empty.

[In CreateDws] If it[Documents] is not empty, it MUST conform to the following XSD: <s:complexType> <s:element name="items"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="item" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xs:complexType> <s:attribute name="Name" type="s:string" /> <s:attribute name="ID" type="s:string" /> </xs:complexType> </s:element> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element> </s:complexType>
[In CreateDws] Name: A string containing a folder-relative URL that identifies a document.
[In CreateDws] ID: A unique string that represents a document key.
[In CreateDwsResponse] This element[CreateDwsResponse] returns the protocol server response to the protocol client.

[In CreateDwsResponse] This element is defined as follows: <s:element name="CreateDwsResponse"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="CreateDwsResult" type="s:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" /> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In CreateDwsResponse] CreateDwsResult: String that contains standâ€“alone XML.

[In CreateDwsResponse] The string [CreateDwsResult] MUST conform to the following XSD: <s:complexType> <s:choice> <s:element ref="tns:Error"/> <s:element name="Results"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="Url" type="s:string" /> <s:element name="DoclibUrl" type="s:string" /> <s:element name="ParentWeb" type="s:string"/> <s:element name="FailedUsers" type="tns:UserType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <s:element name="AddUsersUrl" type="s:string"/> <s:element name="AddUsersRole" type="s:string"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element> </s:choice> </s:complexType>
[In CreateDwsResponse] Error: See section 2.2.3.2 for specification.
[In CreateDwsResponse] Possible values for this operation are listed in the following table: [QuotaExceeded, ServerFailure, AlreadyExists]
[In CreateDwsResponse] QuotaExceeded, Identifier is "14", means: User creating the workspace has exceeded the allocated resource quota.
[In CreateDwsResponse] ServerFailure, Identifier is "1", means: Protocol server encountered an error during the attempt to create the workspace.
[In CreateDwsResponse] AlreadyExists<5>, Identifier is "13", means: A site with the specified name already exists on this site.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-DWSS_R1683.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In CreateDwsResponse] Url: URL for the new workspace.
[In CreateDwsResponse] This [Url] MUST be an absolute URL.
[In CreateDwsResponse] DoclibUrl: Site-relative URL for the shared documents list associated with the workspace.
[In CreateDwsResponse] ParentWeb: Title of the site (2) on which the workspace is created.
[In CreateDwsResponse] If the workspace is the root site of the site collection, this [ParentWeb] MUST be the title of the new workspace.
[In CreateDwsResponse] FailedUsers: A list of users from the users field of CreateDws that could not be added to the list of authorized users in the new workspace.

[In CreateDwsResponse] It[FailedUsers] is standalone XML that MUST use the following definition: <s:complexType name="UserType"> <s:sequence> <s:element name="User" minOccurs="0"> <s:complexType> <s:attribute name="Email" type="s:string"/> </s:complexType> </s:element> </s:sequence> </s:complexType>
[In CreateDwsResponse] AddUsersUrl: An absolute URL to a Web page that provides the ability to add users to the workspace.
[In CreateDwsResponse] AddUsersRole: Role for adding users to the workspace.
[In CreateDwsResponse] If the users parameter to CreateDws (section 3.1.4.2.2.1) was not empty, the value [of AddUsersRole] MUST be the string "Microsoft.SharePoint.SPRoleDefinition".
[In CreateFolder] This operation[CreateFolder] creates a folder in the document library of the current Document Workspace site.

[In CreateFolder] The protocol client sends a CreateFolderSoapIn request message, and the protocol server responds with a CreateFolderSoapOut response message, as follows: <wsdl:operation name="CreateFolder"> <wsdl:input message="tns:CreateFolderSoapIn" /> <wsdl:output message="tns:CreateFolderSoapOut" /> </wsdl:operation>
[In CreateFolder] If the parent folder for the specified URL does not exist, the protocol server MUST return an Error element with a FolderNotFound error code.
[In CreateFolder] If the specified URL already exists, the protocol server MUST return an Error element with an AlreadyExists error code.
[In CreateFolder] If the user does not have sufficient access permissions to create the folder, the protocol server MUST return an Error element with a NoAccess error code.
[In CreateFolder] The protocol server MUST return an Error element with a Failed if an unspecified error prevents creating the specified folder.
[In CreateFolder] The protocol server MUST return an Error element with a ServerFailure error code if an unspecified error prevents creating the specified folder.

[In CreateFolder] If none of the prior conditions [FolderNotFound, AlreadyExists, NoAccess, Failed or ServerFailure] apply, the protocol server MUST create the folder specified in the CreateFolder element.
[In Messages] The following table summarizes the set of WSDL message[CreateFolderSoapIn,CreateFolderSoapOut] definitions that are specific to this operation[CreateFolder].
[In Messages] [The description of] CreateFolderSoapIn [is] Requests a CreateFolder operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.3, on the protocol server.
[In Messages] [The description of] CreateFolderSoapOut[is] Response to a CreateFolderSoapIn request.
[In CreateFolderSoapIn] This message [CreateFolderSoapIn] requests a CreateFolder operation on the protocol server.
[In CreateFolderSoapIn] The SOAP action value of the message is defined as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/dws/CreateFolder
[In CreateFolderSoapIn] The SOAP body contains a CreateFolder element.
[In CreateFolderSoapOut] This message [CreateFolderSoapOut] returns the response.
[In CreateFolderSoapOut] The SOAP action value of the message is defined as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/dws/CreateFolder
[In CreateFolderSoapOut] The SOAP body contains a CreateFolderResponse element.
[In Elements] The following table summarizes the XML schema element[CreateFolder,CreateFolderResponse] definitions that are specific to this operation [CreateFolder].
[In Elements] [The description of] CreateFolder [is:] Contains the parameter for the CreateFolder operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.3.
[In Elements] [The description of] CreateFolderResponse [is:] Contains the response to a CreateFolder operation request.
[In CreateFolder] The CreateFolder element provides a holder for the parameter for the CreateFolder operation.

[In CreateFolder] This element[CreateFolder] is defined as follows: <s:element name="CreateFolder"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="url" type="s:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In CreateFolder] url: This is a site-relative URL with the full path for the new folder<6>.
[In CreateFolderResponse] This element [CreateFolderResponse] contains the response from the protocol server.

[In CreateFolderResponse] This element is defined as follows: <s:element name="CreateFolderResponse"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="CreateFolderResult" type="s:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In CreateFolderResponse] CreateFolderResult: This element contains a string that is interpreted as standalone XML.

[In CreateFolderResult] The element [CreateFolderResult] MUST contain either an Error element or a Result element as follows: <s:complexType> <s:choice> <s:element name="Result"/> <s:element ref="tns:Error"/> </s:choice> </s:complexType>
[In CreateFolderResponse] Error: An Error element as specified in section 2.2.3.2.
[In CreateFolderResponse] Result: An empty Result element ("<Result/>") if the call is successful.
[In DeleteDws] This operation [DeleteDws] deletes a Document Workspace from the protocol server.

[In DeleteDws] The protocol client sends a DeleteDwsSoapIn request message, and the protocol server responds with a DeleteDwsSoapOut response message, as follows: <wsdl:operation name="DeleteDws"> <wsdl:input message="tns:DeleteDwsSoapIn" /> <wsdl:output message="tns:DeleteDwsSoapOut" /> </wsdl:operation>
[In DeleteDws] The protocol server MUST return an Error element with a NoAccess code if the authenticated user is not authorized to delete the Document Workspace.
[In DeleteDws] If the specified Document Workspace has subsites, the protocol server MUST return an Error element with the WebContainsSubwebs error code.
[In DeleteDws] If the specified Document Workspace does not exist, the protocol server SHOULD<7> return HTTP status code 404 with response body which contains text "404 FILE NOT FOUND".
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-DWSS_R1164, MS-DWSS_R2164, MS-DWSS_R3164.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In DeleteDws] If the specified Document Workspace is the root site of the site collection, the protocol server MUST return an Error element with the ServerFailure error code.
[In DeleteDws] If none of the prior conditions apply, the protocol server MUST delete the specified Document Workspace and return a Result element.
[In Messages] The following table summarizes the set of WSDL message [DeleteDwsSoapIn,DeleteDwsSoapOut] definitions that are specific to this operation[DeleteDws].
[In Messages] [The description of] DeleteDwsSoapIn [is:] Request for the DeleteDws operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.4.
[In Messages] [The description of] DeleteDwsSoapOut Response [is:] to a DeleteDwsSoapIn request that returns the operation status.
[In DeleteDwsSoapIn] This message [DeleteDwsSoapIn] requests the DeleteDws operation.
[In DeleteDwsSoapIn] The SOAP action value of the message is defined as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/dws/DeleteDws
[In DeleteDwsSoapIn] The SOAP body contains a DeleteDws element.
[In DeleteDwsSoapOut] This message [DeleteDwsSoapOut] returns the operation status.
[In DeleteDwsSoapOut] The SOAP action value of the message is defined as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/dws/DeleteDws
[In DeleteDwsSoapOut] The SOAP body contains a DeleteDwsResponse element.
[In Elements] The following table summarizes the XML schema element definitions[DeleteDws,DeleteDwsResponse] that are specific to this operation[DeleteDws].
[In Elements] [The description of] DeleteDws [is:] Contains the parameters for a DeleteDws operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.4.
[In Elements] [The description of] DeleteDwsResponse [is:] Contains the response to a DeleteDws operation request.
[In DeleteDws] This element[DeleteDws] requests a DeleteDws operation.
[In DeleteDws] This element[DeleteDws] is defined as follows: <s:element name="DeleteDws"> <s:complexType/> </s:element>
[In DeleteDwsResponse] This element[DeleteDwsResponse] contains the response from the protocol server.

[In DeleteDwsResponse] [Element DeleteDwsResponse is defined as follows:] <s:element name="DeleteDwsResponse"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="DeleteDwsResult" type="s:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In DeleteDwsResponse] DeleteDwsResult: This element contains the protocol server response to the DeleteDws operation.
[In DeleteDwsResponse] This element[DeleteDwsResponse] contains a string that is standâ€“alone XML.

[In DeleteDwsResponse] The string[DeleteDwsResult] MUST conform to either the Error element or a Result element as follows: <s:complexType> <s:choice> <s:element ref="tns:Error"/> <s:element name="Result"/> </s:choice> </s:complexType>
[In DeleteDwsResponse] Error: An Error element as specified in section 2.2.3.2.
[In DeleteDwsResponse] Result: An empty Result element ("<Result/>") if the call is successful.
[In DeleteFolder] This operation[DeleteFolder] deletes a folder from a document library on the site.

[In DeleteFolder] The protocol client sends a DeleteFolderSoapIn request message, and the protocol server responds with a DeleteFolderSoapOut response message, as follows: <wsdl:operation name="DeleteFolder"> <wsdl:input message="tns:DeleteFolderSoapIn" /> <wsdl:output message="tns:DeleteFolderSoapOut" /> </wsdl:operation>
[In DeleteFolder] If the parent of the specified URL does not exist, the protocol server MUST return an Error element with a FolderNotFound error code.
[In DeleteFolder] If the specified URL does not exist, the protocol server MUST return a Result element as specified in DeleteFolderResponse (section 3.1.4.5.2.2).
[In DeleteFolder] If an unspecified error prevents the deletion of the specified folder, the protocol server MUST return an Error element with a Failed error code.
[In DeleteFolder] If an unspecified error prevents the deletion of the specified folder, the protocol server MUST return a ServerFailure error code.

[In DeleteFolder] If none of the prior conditions apply, the protocol server MUST delete the folder specified in the CreateFolder element and return a Result element as specified in DeleteFolderResponse (section 3.1.4.5.2.2).
[In Messages] The following table summarizes the set of WSDL message[DeleteFolderSoapIn,DeleteFolderSoapOut] definitions that are specific to this operation[DeleteFolder].
[In Messages] [The description of] DeleteFolderSoapIn[is:] Request for a DeleteFolder operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.5.
[In Messages] [The description of] DeleteFolderSoapOut[is:] Response to a DeleteFolderSoapIn request.
[In DeleteFolderSoapIn] This message [DeleteFolderSoapIn] requests the DeleteFolder operation.
[In DeleteFolderSoapIn] The SOAP action value of the message is defined as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/dws/DeleteFolder
[In DeleteFolderSoapIn] The SOAP body contains a DeleteFolder element.
[In DeleteFolderSoapOut] This message [DeleteFolderSoapOut] responds to a protocol client.
[In DeleteFolderSoapOut] The SOAP action value of the message is defined as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/dws/DeleteFolder
[In DeleteFolderSoapOut] The SOAP body contains a DeleteFolderResponse element.
[In Elements] The following table summarizes the XML schema element[DeleteFolder,DeleteFolderResponse] definitions that are specific to this operation[DeleteFolder].
[In Elements] [The description of] DeleteFolder [is:] Contains the parameter for the DeleteFolder operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.5.
[In Elements] [The description of] DeleteFolderResponse [is:] Contains the response to the DeleteFolder operation request.
[In DeleteFolder] The DeleteFolder element contains the parameter for the DeleteFolder operation.

[In DeleteFolder] This element[DeleteFolder] is defined as follows: <s:element name="DeleteFolder"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="url" type="s:string" minOccurs="0"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In DeleteFolder] url: This is a site-relative URL specifying the folder to delete.
[In DeleteFolderResponse] The DeleteFolderResponse element contains the response from the protocol server.

[In DeleteFolderResponse] This element is defined as follows: <s:element name="DeleteFolderResponse"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="DeleteFolderResult" type="s:string" minOccurs="0"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In DeleteFolderResponse] DeleteFolderResult: This element is a string that contains standâ€“alone XML.

[In DeleteFolderResponse] The XML MUST conform to either the Error element or a Result element as follows: <s:complexType> <s:choice> <s:element ref="tns:Error"/> <s:element name="Result"/> </s:choice> </s:complexType>
[In DeleteFolderResponse] Error: An Error element as specified in section 2.2.3.2.
[In DeleteFolderResponse] Result: An empty Result element ("<Result/>") if the call is successful.
[In FindDwsDoc] This operation obtains a URL for a named document in a Document Workspace.

[In FindDwsDoc] The protocol client sends a FindDwsDocSoapIn request message, and the protocol server responds with a FindDwsDocSoapOut response message, as follows: <wsdl:operation name="FindDwsDoc"> <wsdl:input message="tns:FindDwsDocSoapIn" /> <wsdl:output message="tns:FindDwsDocSoapOut" /> </wsdl:operation>
[In FindDwsDoc] If the protocol server cannot locate a document with the specified identifier, it MUST return an Error element with a code of ItemNotFound.
[In FindDwsDoc] If the protocol server encounters another error that prevents it from providing a response with the correct URL, it MUST return an Error element with a code of ServerFailure.
[In FindDwsDoc] If none of the prior conditions apply, the protocol server SHOULD reply with a Result element as specified in FindDwsDocResponse containing an absolute URL for the specified document.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-DWSS_R687.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Messages] The following table summarizes the set of WSDL message[FindDwsDocSoapIn,FindDwsDocSoapOut] definitions that are specific to this operation[FindDwsDoc].
[In Messages] [The description of] FindDwsDocSoapIn [is:] Request for a FindDwsDoc operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.6.
[In Messages] [The description of] FindDwsDocSoapIn [is:] FindDwsDocSoapOut[is:] Response to a FindDwsDocSoapIn request.
[In FindDwsDocSoapIn] This message [FindDwsDocSoapIn] initiates a FindDwsDoc WSDL operation.
[In FindDwsDocSoapIn] The SOAP action value of the message is defined as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/dws/FindDwsDoc
[In FindDwsDocSoapIn] The SOAP body contains a FindDwsDoc element.
[In FindDwsDocSoapOut] This message [FindDwsDocSoapOut] provides a response.
[In FindDwsDocSoapOut] The SOAP action value of the message is defined as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/dws/FindDwsDoc
[In FindDwsDocSoapOut] The SOAP body contains a FindDwsDocResponse element.
[In Elements] The following table summarizes the XML schema element[FindDwsDoc,FindDwsDocResponse] definitions that are specific to this operation[FindDwsDoc].
[In Elements] [The description of] FindDwsDoc [is:] Contains the parameter for the FindDwsDoc operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.6.
[In Elements] [The description of] FindDwsDocResponse [is:] Contains the response to a FindDwsDoc operation request.
[In FindDwsDoc] This element[FindDwsDoc] contains the id parameter for the FindDwsDoc operation.

[In FindDwsDoc] This element[FindDwsDoc] is defined as follows: <s:element name="FindDwsDoc"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="id" type="s:string" minOccurs="0"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In FindDwsDoc] id: See the description of the ID attribute of the Documents element of CreateDws, specified in section 3.1.4.2.2.1.
[In FindDwsDocResponse] This element[FindDwsDocResponse] contains the response from the protocol server.

[In FindDwsDocResponse] This element[FindDwsDocResponse] is defined as follows: <s:element name="FindDwsDocResponse"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="FindDwsDocResult" type="s:string" minOccurs="0"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>

[In FindDwsDocResponse] FindDwsDocResult: This element contains a string that is standâ€“alone XML encoded either as an Error element as specified in 2.2.3.2 or a Result element defined as follows: <s:complexType> <s:choice> <s:element ref="tns:Error"/> <s:element name="Result" type="s:string"/> </s:choice> </s:complexType>
[In FindDwsDocResponse] Error: An Error element as specified in section 2.2.3.2.
[In FindDwsDocResponse] Result: A Result element for which the content MUST be an absolute URL that refers to the requested document.
[In GetDwsData] This operation[GetDwsData] returns general information about the Document Workspace site, as well as its members, documents, links, and tasks.

[In GetDwsData] The protocol client sends a GetDwsDataSoapIn request message, and the protocol server responds with a GetDwsDataSoapOut response message, as follows: <wsdl:operation name="GetDwsData"> <wsdl:input message="tns:GetDwsDataSoapIn" /> <wsdl:output message="tns:GetDwsDataSoapOut" /> </wsdl:operation>

[In GetDwsData] If the protocol client provides a non-empty document parameter and the protocol server cannot locate the document, the protocol server SHOULD return an Error element with the ListNotFound code.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-DWSS_R688.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In GetDwsData] If the protocol server detects an access restriction during processing, it MUST return an Error with the NoAccess code and a URL for an authentication page.
[In GetDwsData] If the protocol server detects some other problem during processing, it MUST return an Error with the ServerFailure code.
[In GetDwsData] If no Error elements are returned as previously described, the protocol server MUST return a Result element with the appropriate information for the Document Workspace and document.
[In Messages] The following table summarizes the set of WSDL message[GetDwsDataSoapIn,GetDwsDataSoapOut] definitions that are specific to this operation[GetDwsData].
[In Messages] [The description of] GetDwsDataSoapIn[is:] Request for a GetDwsData operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.7.
[In Messages] [The description of] GetDwsDataSoapOut [is:] Response to a GetDwsDataSoapIn request.
[In GetDwsDataSoapIn] This message [GetDwsDataSoapIn] requests a GetDwsData operation.
[In GetDwsDataSoapIn] The SOAP action value of the message is defined as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/dws/GetDwsData
[In GetDwsDataSoapIn] The SOAP body contains a GetDwsData element.
[In GetDwsDataSoapOut] This message [GetDwsDataSoapOut] returns the results of a GetDwsData operation.
[In GetDwsDataSoapOut] The SOAP action value of the message is defined as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/dws/GetDwsData
[In GetDwsDataSoapOut] The SOAP body contains a GetDwsDataResponse element.
[In Elements] The following table summarizes the XML schema element[GetDwsData,GetDwsDataResponse] definitions that are specific to this operation[GetDwsData].
[In Elements] [The description of] GetDwsData Contains [is:] the parameters for the GetDwsData operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.7.
[In Elements] [The description of] GetDwsDataResponse [is:] Contains the response to a GetDwsData operation request.
[In GetDwsData] This element[GetDwsData] provides the parameters for the GetDwsData operation.

[In GetDwsData] This element[GetDwsData] is defined as follows: <s:element name="GetDwsData"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="document" type="s:string" minOccurs="0"/> <s:element name="lastUpdate" type="s:string" minOccurs="0"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In GetDwsData] document: A site-based URL of a document in the document library in the Document Workspace.
[In GetDwsData] This argument [document] provides the context for the documents list in the reply.
[In GetDwsData] lastUpdate: Contains the lastUpdate value returned in the result of a previous GetDwsData or GetDwsMetaData operation, or an empty string.
[In GetDwsData] If the list in the Document Workspace has not changed since lastUpdate, GetDwsData MUST return a NoChanges child element of the List element as specified in GetDwsDataResponse.
[In GetDwsData] If the protocol client provides an empty string, the protocol server MUST provide all data for the specified context.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-DWSS_R729.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In GetDwsData] If the protocol client provides an empty string, the protocol server MUST provide [all] data for the specified context.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] This element[GetDwsDataResponse] returns the response to the GetDwsData operation.

[In GetDwsDataResponse] This element is defined as follows: <s:element name="GetDwsDataResponse"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="GetDwsDataResult" type="s:string" minOccurs="0"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In GetDwsDataResponse] GetDwsDataResult: This structure is a string that contains standâ€“alone XML.

[In GetDwsDataResponse] The XML MUST conform to the following schema: <s:complexType name="GetDwsDataResultType"> <s:choice> <s:element ref="tns:Error"/> <s:element ref="tns:Results"/> </s:choice> </s:complexType>
[In GetDwsDataResponse] Error: An Error element as specified in section 2.2.3.2.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] Results: The Results element contains the requested data as a string.

[In GetDwsDataResponse] Results: It MUST conform to the following schema: <s:element name="Results"> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Title" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="LastUpdate" type="xs:integer"/> <xs:element name="User"> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ID" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="Name" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="LoginName" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="Email" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="IsDomainGroup"> <s:simpleType> <s:restriction base="s:string"> <s:enumeration value="True" /> <s:enumeration value="False" /> </s:restriction> </s:simpleType> </xs:element> <xs:element name="IsSiteAdmin"> <s:simpleType> <s:restriction base="s:string"> <s:enumeration value="True" /> <s:enumeration value="False" /> </s:restriction> </s:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> <xs:element name="Members" type="tns:MemberData"/> <xs:sequence minOccurs="0"> <xs:element ref="tns:Assignees"/> <xs:element ref="tns:List"/> <xs:element ref="tns:List"/> <xs:element ref="tns:List"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </s:element>
[In GetDwsDataResponse] Title: The title of the workspace.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] LastUpdate: An integer indicating the last time that the workspace was updated.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] This value [LastUpdate] can be used by a protocol client during GetDwsData or GetDwsMetaData operations.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] This value [LastUpdate] can be used by a client during GetDwsData operation.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] User: The member information for the user who requested the GetDwsData operation.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] The content of this element MUST be a Member element as specified in section 2.2.3.5, with the exception that both IsDomainGroup and Email MUST be present.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] In addition, the IsSiteAdmin element MUST be present.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] In addition, the IsSiteAdmin element MUST contain a Boolean value.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] Members: This element MUST conform to the schema for the complex data type MemberData.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] The following elements MUST be present for the GetDwsData operation: [Assignees, List, List, and List].
[In GetDwsDataResponse] The elements [Assignees, List, List, and List] MUST NOT be present if this data is being returned by GetDwsMetaData and the minimal parameter is set to TRUE.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] This element [Assignees] MUST conform to the Assignees element schema specified in section 2.2.3.1.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] Assignees: This element specifies the users assigned to the workspace.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] List: This element contains information about the Tasks list.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] The Name attribute MUST be set to "Tasks".
[In GetDwsDataResponse] The type of the List element MUST be List.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] List: This element contains information about the Documents list.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] The Name attribute MUST be set to "Documents".
[In GetDwsDataResponse] The type of the List element MUST be List.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] If the URL specified in the GetDwsData request cannot be found, the protocol server MUST return an Error element with a code of ListNotFound.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] List: This element contains information about the Links list.
[In GetDwsDataResponse] The Name attribute MUST be set to "Links".
[In GetDwsDataResponse] The type of the List element MUST be List.
[In GetDwsMetaData] This operation[GetDwsMetaData] returns information about a Document Workspace site and the lists that it contains.

[In GetDwsMetaData] The protocol client sends a GetDwsMetaDataSoapIn request message, and the protocol server responds with the following GetDwsMetaDataSoapOut response message: <wsdl:operation name="GetDwsMetaData"> <wsdl:input message="tns:GetDwsMetaDataSoapIn" /> <wsdl:output message="tns:GetDwsMetaDataSoapOut" /> </wsdl:operation>
[In GetDwsMetaData] The protocol client sends a GetDwsMetaDataSoapIn request message containing the GetDwsMetaData element with operation parameters.
[In GetDwsMetaData] The protocol server processes the operation and returns its results in a GetDwsMetaDataResponse element.
[In GetDwsMetaData] The element[GetDwsMetaDataResponse] contains a string that is standâ€“alone XML.
[In GetDwsMetaData] The schema of the XML is specified in the following sections.
[In GetDwsMetaData] Because of the complexity of the return structure, the details are discussed in the appropriate schema definition section.
[In Messages] The following table summarizes the set of WSDL message[GetDwsMetaDataSoapIn,GetDwsMetaDataSoapOut] definitions that are specific to this operation[GetDwsMetaData].
[In Messages] [The description of] GetDwsMetaDataSoapIn [is:] Request for a GetDwsMetaData operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.8.
[In Messages] [The description of] GetDwsMetaDataSoapOut [is:] Response to a GetDwsMetaDataSoapIn request.
[In GetDwsMetaDataSoapIn] This message [GetDwsMetaDataSoapIn] requests the GetDwsMetaData operation.
[In GetDwsMetaDataSoapIn] The SOAP action value of the message is defined as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/dws/GetDwsMetaData
[In GetDwsMetaDataSoapIn] The SOAP body contains a GetDwsMetaData element.
[In GetDwsMetaDataSoapOut] This message [GetDwsMetaDataSoapOut] returns the results of a GetDwsMetaData operation.
[In GetDwsMetaDataSoapOut] The SOAP action value of the message is defined as follows: http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/soap/dws/GetDwsMetaData
[In GetDwsMetaDataSoapOut] The SOAP body contains a GetDwsMetaDataResponse element.
[In Elements] The following table summarizes the XML schema element[GetDwsMetaData,GetDwsMetaDataResponse,ListInfo] definitions that are specific to this operation.
[In Elements] [The description of] GetDwsMetaData[is] Contains the parameters for the GetDwsMetaData operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.8.
[In Elements] [The description of] GetDwsMetaDataResponse [is] Contains the response to a GetDwsMetaData operation request.
[In Elements] [The description of] ListInfo [is] Contains metadata about a list in a Document Workspace.
[In GetDwsMetaData] This element[GetDwsMetaData] contains the parameters to the GetDwsMetaData operation.

[In GetDwsMetaData] This element[GetDwsMetaData] is defined as follows: <s:element name="GetDwsMetaData"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element name="document" type="s:string" minOccurs="0"/> <s:element name="id" type="s:string" minOccurs="0"/> <s:element name="minimal" type="s:boolean"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>
[In GetDwsMetaData] document: This is a site-relative URL that specifies the list or document to describe in the response.
[In GetDwsMetaData] ID: See the ID attribute of the Documents element of CreateDws, specified in section 3.1.4.2.2.1.

[In GetDwsMetaData] If this parameter[id] is not NULL or empty, the server will ignore the document parameter, and get a value according to the key id from the Documents key-value pair, then update the document parameter with the value.
[In GetDwsMetaData] Minimal: A Boolean value that specifies whether to return information.

[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] false, the protocol server MUST return the following elements from the Results element of GetDwsMetaData, and MUST NOT return them otherwise: SubscribeUrl ListInfo (Tasks) ListInfo (Documents) ListInfo (Links)

[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] true, the protocol server MUST NOT return the following elements[, and MUST return them otherwise]: From the GetDwsMetaData Results element: SubscribeUrl ListInfo (Tasks) ListInfo (Documents) ListInfo (Links)
[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] false, the protocol server MUST return the following elements: From the GetDwsMetaData Results element: SubscribeUrl
[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] false and the workspace that document belongs to contains a Tasks list, the protocol server will return the Schema (Tasks) element[, and otherwise not].

[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] false and the workspace that document belongs to contains a DocumentLibrary list, the protocol server will return the Schema (Documents) element[, and otherwise not].
[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] false and the workspace that document belongs to contains a Links list, the protocol server will return the Schema (Links) element[, and otherwise not].
[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] false, the protocol server MUST return the following elements: From the GetDwsMetaData Results element: ListInfo (Tasks)
[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] false, the protocol server MUST return the following elements: From the GetDwsMetaData Results element: ListInfo (Documents)
[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] false, the protocol server MUST return the following elements: From the GetDwsMetaData Results element: ListInfo (Links)
[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] true, the protocol server MUST NOT return them: From the GetDwsMetaData Results element: SubscribeUrl
[In GetDwsMetaData] [If [Minimal is] false and the workspace that document belongs to contains a Tasks list, the protocol server will return the Schema (Tasks) element], and otherwise not.
[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] true, the protocol server won't return the Schema (Tasks) element.
[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] false and the the workspace that document belongs to doesn't contain a Tasks list, the protocol server won't return the Schema (Tasks) element.

[In GetDwsMetaData] [If [Minimal is] false and the workspace that document belongs to contains a DocumentLibrary list, the protocol server will return the Schema (Documents) element], and otherwise not.
[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] true, the protocol server won't return the Schema (Documents) element.
[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] false and the workspace that document belongs to doesn't contain a DocumentLibrary list, the protocol server won't return the Schema (Documents) element.
[In GetDwsMetaData] [If [Minimal is] false and the workspace that document belongs to contains a Links list, the protocol server will return the Schema (Links) element], and otherwise not.
[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] true, the protocol server won't return the Schema (Links) element.
[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] false and the workspace that document belongs to doesn't contain a Links list, the protocol server won't return the Schema (Links) element.
[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] true, the protocol server MUST NOT return them: From the GetDwsMetaData Results element: ListInfo (Tasks)
[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] true, the protocol server MUST NOT return them: From the GetDwsMetaData Results element: ListInfo (Documents)
[In GetDwsMetaData] If [Minimal is] true, the protocol server MUST NOT return them: From the GetDwsMetaData Results element: ListInfo (Links)
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] This element[GetDwsMetaDataResponse] contains the protocol server response to a GetDwsMetaData operation.

[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] The element[GetDwsMetaDataResponse] contains a string that is stand-alone XML, defined as follows: <s:element name="GetDwsMetaDataResponse"> <s:complexType> <s:sequence> <s:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="GetDwsMetaDataResult" type="tns:GetDwsMetaDataResultType"/> </s:sequence> </s:complexType> </s:element>

[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] GetDwsMetaDataResult: This element contains a string that is stand-alone XML, encoded either as an Error element as specified in section 2.2.3.2 or a Result element defined as follows: <s:complexType name="GetDwsMetaDataResultType"> <s:choice> <s:element ref="tns:Error"/> <s:element name="Results"> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="SubscribeUrl" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="MtgInstance" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="SettingUrl" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="PermsUrl" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="UserInfoUrl" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element ref="tns:Roles"/> <xs:element ref="tns:Schema" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="3"/> <xs:element ref="tns:ListInfo" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="3"/> <xs:element name="Permissions"> <xs:complexType> <xs:choice> <xs:element ref="tns:Error"/> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ManageSubwebs" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="ManageWeb" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="ManageRoles" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="ManageLists" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="InsertListItems" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="EditListItems" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="DeleteListItems" minOccurs="0"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:choice> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> <xs:element name="HasUniquePerm"/> <xs:element name="WorkspaceType"/> <xs:element name="IsADMode"/> <xs:element name="DocUrl"/> <xs:element name="Minimal"/> <s:element ref="tns:Results"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </s:element> </s:choice> </s:complexType>
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] If the element is an Error, it[GetDwsMetaDataResult] MUST contain an error code as specified in section 2.2.3.2.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] It[GetDwsMetaDataResult] MUST contain one of the error codes from the following table: [NoAccess, DocumentNotFound, ServerFailure].
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] DocumentNotFound means: Site or document could not be found.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] NoAccess means: Authenticated user is not permitted to access this information.<8>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-DWSS_R1680.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] NoAccess means: The Error element MUST contain the URL of a page where the user can request access permission.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] ServerFailure means: Protocol server encountered an unspecified error during operation processing.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] SubscribeUrl: This is the URI of a page that enables users to subscribe to changes in the document specified in the parameters.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] See [MS-OSALER] and [MS-ALERTSS] for more information about alert subscriptions.

[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] MtgInstance: If document element specifies a meeting item, this element MUST represent a string that contains the meeting information. The meeting information contains the instance identifier of the meeting.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] MtgInstance: Otherwise, the element [MtgInstance] SHOULD be empty.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-DWSS_R689.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] SettingUrl: URI of a page that enables workspace settings to be modified.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] PermsUrl: URI of a page that enables the workspace permissions settings to be modified.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] UserInfoUrl: URI of a page that enables the list of users to be modified.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] Roles: Specifies the roles that apply to the workspace.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] This element [Roles] MUST conform to the element specification in 2.2.3.6.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] Schema: Contains the schema information for the following workspace lists appearing in a sequence as below.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] The element[Schema] MUST conform to the Schema element in the xml element specified in section 2.2.4.2. Tasks<9> Documents Links
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-DWSS_R256, MS-DWSS_R257, MS-DWSS_R258.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] This element[Schema] MUST conform to the Schema element Tasks<9>.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-DWSS_R2561, MS-DWSS_R2562.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] This element[Schema] MUST conform to the Schema element Documents.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] This element[Schema] MUST conform to the Schema element Links.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] ListInfo: This element contains list information for the following workspace lists appearing in a sequence as below.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] This element [ListInfo] MUST conform to the ListInfo element specified in section 3.1.4.8.2.3. Tasks Documents Links
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-DWSS_R261, MS-DWSS_R262, MS-DWSS_R263.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] This element [ListInfo] MUST conform to the ListInfo element Tasks.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] This element [ListInfo] MUST conform to the ListInfo element Documents.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] This element [ListInfo] MUST conform to the ListInfo element Links.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] The element [Schema] MUST conform to the Schema element in the xml element specified in [MS-PRSTFR] section 2.3.1.2.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] Permissions: This element contains the permissions of the authenticated user for this Document Workspace.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] This element[permission] contains elements that indicate permissible operations.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] This element [ListInfo] MUST conform to the ListInfo element specified in 3.1.4.8.2.3.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] The list of elements[permission] that can be present are described in the WSDL specified in section 6.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] Each element[permission] represents the ability to perform the action for which it is named.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] HasUniquePerm: Set to True if, and only if, the workspace has custom role assignments.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] HasUniquePerm: Set to False, if role assignments are inherited from the site in which the workspace is created.
[In GetDwsMetaDataResponse] WorkspaceType: This value MUST be "DWS", "MWS", or an empty string.
